This is earthquake country; an ordinary visitor to the top of Loma Prieta sees the dramatic landscape of the coastal ranges, but a scientist can read the land -- the San Andreas Fault in a long, long rift valley not a mile away. A scientist sees the little hills, the minor landslides, the small slumps in the land forms, the bands of green trees that mark smaller faults like the Sargent Fault.
